content.description: This is a Darren Knezek classic and one of the longest one pitch climbs I’ve ever done. It climbs a crack like feature up the face of Quatize like rock. About half way up, you’ll find the crux as the crack turns into a thin chimney. Above that the crack ends and there are a lot of flakes and edges to the top out.
content.protection: There are something like 21 or so bolts to fixed chain anchors.
content.location: It is just a short ways up the road from Knezek didn’t fall here. If you go just up the road you’ll see a fork just past all the climbs on your left. If you park there and go across the Monroe Creek you’ll see a small Island surrounded by cliffs. If you’re facing the cliffs it will be on the far right side of the island.
